nodes.bodyText: is this too low level? (as it's not something the users can configure)
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -25,6 +25,19 @@ Other versions:
 
 // tag::notable-highlights[]
 [discrete]
+[[indexing-speed-improvement]]
+===  Indexing speed improvement
+
+{es} 7.10 improves the indexing speed by 5-20%, depending on your workload.
+We've reduced the amount of coordination needed to add entries to the
+<<index-modules-translog,transaction log>>, enabling more concurrency, and
+incresed the transaction log buffer size from `8KB` to `1MB`.

nodes.bodyText: I think this is still worth highlighting as it's a change users may notice or be interested in.

nodes.bodyText:
I made some minor changes to improve the flow. However, the current text is
fine as-is as long as the incresed typo is fixed.

  
    
  
    

  
  This file contains bidirectional Unicode text that may be interpreted or compiled differently than what appears below. To review, open the file in an editor that reveals hidden Unicode characters. Learn more about bidirectional Unicode characters


  


    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            {es} 7.10 improves the indexing speed by 5-20%, depending on your workload.
          
          
            
            We've reduced the amount of coordination needed to add entries to the
          
          
            
            <<index-modules-translog,transaction log>>, enabling more concurrency, and
          
          
            
            incresed the transaction log buffer size from `8KB` to `1MB`.
          
          
            
            
          
          
            
            The performance gains are lower in intensive analysis scenarios (ie. full-text
          
          
            
            search analysis).
          
          
            
            {es} 7.10 improves indexing speed by 5-20%. We've reduced the coordination
          
          
            
            needed to add entries to the <<index-modules-translog,transaction log>>. This
          
          
            
            reduction allows for more concurrency and increases the transaction log buffer
          
          
            
            size from `8KB` to `1MB`. However, performance gains are lower for
          
          
            
            full-text search and other analysis-intensive use cases.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -25,6 +25,19 @@ Other versions:
 
 // tag::notable-highlights[]
 [discrete]
+[[indexing-speed-improvement]]
+===  Indexing speed improvement
+
+{es} 7.10 improves the indexing speed by 5-20%, depending on your workload.
+We've reduced the amount of coordination needed to add entries to the
+<<index-modules-translog,transaction log>>, enabling more concurrency, and
+incresed the transaction log buffer size from `8KB` to `1MB`.
+
+The performance gains are lower in intensive analysis scenarios (ie. full-text
+search analysis).

nodes.bodyText: +1 to James' suggestion. I'd mention ingest pipelines too. Something along the lines of "The heavier the indexing chain, the lower the gains, so indexing chains that involve many fields, ingest pipelines or full-text indexing will see lower gains."
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -25,6 +25,19 @@ Other versions:
 
 // tag::notable-highlights[]
 [discrete]
+[[indexing-speed-improvement]]
+===  Indexing speed improvement
+
+{es} 7.10 improves the indexing speed by 5-20%, depending on your workload.
+We've reduced the amount of coordination needed to add entries to the
+<<index-modules-translog,transaction log>>, enabling more concurrency, and
+incresed the transaction log buffer size from `8KB` to `1MB`.
+
+The performance gains are lower in intensive analysis scenarios (ie. full-text
+search analysis).

nodes.bodyText: Maybe say "up to 20%" without providing a lower bound. As you highlighted later, scenarios with full-text indexing or ingest might not notice a speedup.
